title.narrative: Support to Bhutan Floods through UNDP

description.narrative: The torrential rains in the catchment areas of the main rivers due to onset of the monsoons in the region in July 2016 has led to flash floods and landslides impacting and cutting off many parts of southern Bhutan. Four districts, Samtse, Chhukha, Tsirang and Sarpang, in the southern part of Bhutan are the worst affected by floods. The main subdivisions in these districts affected are Phuentsholing, Lhamoiyzingkha and Gelephu. At the local level, Gelephu Thromde, incurred some of the most severe damage and losses of infrastructure and assets. Amongst them, the most critical was the damage of the protection structures of the town’s main water supply system. Funding under this investment provides support to the United Nations Development Programme for the implementation of Recovery of Protection Structures of the Gelephu Thromde-Mao Chhu Infiltration Gallery and Water Treatment Plant. The total value of this investment is $0.1 million to be expensed during the 2016-17 financial year.
